content.question: A planet, a moon, and a star are aligned as shown. The moon has mass <math alttext="M sub lowercase m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>M</mi><mi>m</mi></msub></math> and is a distance <math alttext="r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi></math> from the center of the planet. The planet has mass <math alttext="M sub p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>M</mi><mi>p</mi></msub></math> and is a distance <math alttext="D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>D</mi></math> from the center of the star of mass <math alttext="M sub s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>M</mi><mi>s</mi></msub></math>. Which of the following is a correct expression for the total gravitational potential energy of this three-body system?
